text: Julie D. Fisher is an American diplomat, currently serving as a Deputy Assistant Secretary of State who has been nominated to be the United States Ambassador to Belarus. == Early life and education == Fisher earned her Bachelor of Arts from the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill and an Master of Public Policy from Princeton University."Announces Intent to Nominate and Appoint Individuals to Key Administration Posts" White House, April 20, 2020 == Career == Fisher is a career member of the Senior Foreign Service, class of Counselor. She currently serves as Deputy Assistant Secretary of State for Western Europe and the European Union in the State Department's Bureau of European and Eurasian Affairs. She also served on special assignment as Chargé d'Affaires a.i. of the U.S. Embassy in Russia. She was the Deputy Chief of Mission of the U.S. Mission to NATO; the Chief of Staff to the State Department's Deputy Secretary for Management and Resources; and the Director of the State Department Operations Center. Earlier assignments include service as Deputy Director of the Private Office of the Secretary General of NATO where she covered North American affairs, the Baltic states, Operations policies and issues related to defense and deterrence posture. Prior to that she served as Counselor for Political and Economic Affairs at the U.S. Embassy in Tbilisi, Georgia. On April 20, 2020, President Trump announced his intent to nominate Fisher to serve as the United States Ambassador to Belarus. On May 4, 2020, her nomination was sent to the Senate."Thirty Nominations and One Withdrawal Sent to the Senate", The White House, May 4, 2020 Her nomination is currently pending before the United States Senate Committee on Foreign Relations. == Personal life == She speaks Russian, French, and Georgian. ==See also== *List of ambassadors of the United States ==References== Category:Living people Category:Year of birth missing (living people) Category:Place of birth missing (living people) Category:21st- century American diplomats Category:American women diplomats Category:Princeton University alumni Category:United States Department of State officials Category:University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill alumni
title: Julie D. Fisher
